Predict from a cosinor model

Source: R/predict.cosinor.glmm.R
predict.cosinor.glmm.Rd

Given a time variable and optional covariates, generate predicted values from a cosinor fit. Default prediction is the mean value, optionally can predict at a given month

Usage

# S3 method for cosinor.glmm
predict(object, newdata, se.fit = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class cosinor.glmm

newdata

Optional new data

se.fit

Logical argument indicating whether to determine standard error (default = TRUE)

...

other arguments passed to glmmTMB:::predict.glmmTMB

Value

Returns predicted values from the cosinor model.

Examples


fit <- cosinor.glmm(Y ~ X + amp.acro(time,
  group = "X",
  n_components = 1,
  period = 12
), data = vitamind)
predict(fit)
